== International Reactions==
== International Reactions==

Former March 14 Prime Minister and leader of [[anti-Syrian]] forces in [[Lebanon]] [[Saad Hariri]] condemned what he called a "massacre" and the "bloody murders" that he said the Syrian people endure.<ref>[http://www.nowlebanon.com/NewsArticleDetails.aspx?ID=296186 Lebanon news - NOW Lebanon -Hariri condemns âmassacreâ in Syriaâs Hama<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
+
Former Prime Minister and leader of [[March 14 alliance]] forces in [[Lebanon]] [[Saad Hariri]] condemned what he called a "massacre" and the "bloody murders" that he said the Syrian people endure.<ref>[http://www.nowlebanon.com/NewsArticleDetails.aspx?ID=296186 Lebanon news - NOW Lebanon -Hariri condemns âmassacreâ in Syriaâs Hama<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
[[United States]] President[[Barack Obama]] said the reports from Hama were horrifying and demonstrated the true character of the Syrian regime. "Once again, President Assad has shown that he is completely incapable and unwilling to respond to the legitimate grievances of the Syrian people," he said. He said he was appalled by the government's use of "violence and brutality against its own people".<ref>[http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-14360027 BBC News - Syria unrest: Barack Obama condemns 'brutal' Hama raid<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
